page.title: 02Motorways near Strensham
page.content: The M5 motorway from Birmingham to Plymouth, and the M50 to Ross pass through the area, linking at junction 8 of the M5. There is access to either motorway from the A38 as the M50 joins it at Junction 1. The M50 was built in 1960 and the section of the M5 from Strensham services to junction 8 was completed in 1962. Both are two lane carriageways. Congestion of traffic is frequent, particularly in the summer months. There are plans to make the M5 into three lanes in the late 1980's. The continuation of the M5 from the junction with the M50 has three lanes, as it was built at a later date. Motorway maintenance is carried out from Strensham maintenance compound which is situated at the edge of the service area.Motorway police from West Mercia patrol the M50 and M5 north of J8 and Gloucestershire south of it.
